Their attack may cause Poison, so the party should carry some Antidotes when traveling through the Marsh Cave. sourcesContent:
const products = [
  {
    _id: "1",
    name: "CHIMERA",
    image: "frontend/public/images/Chimera-01-XIV.jpg",
    description:
      "As a final boss of Cutter's Cry, the origins of this nightmarish combination of lion, goat, and dragon have been furiously debated. Some deem the creature a cruel jest of the gods, while others believe it the twisted creation of forbidden sorcery.",
    brand: "Final Fantasy II",
    category: "Fire",
    price: 9.99,
    countInStock: 10,
    rating: 4.5,
    numReviews: 12,
  },
  {
    _id: "2",
    name: "GOLEM",
    image: "frontend/public/images/Golem-03-XIV.png",
    description:
      "Golems are magical constructs of clay or stone that have been imbued with temporary life. Ancient tomes claim that the creation of these beings is only possible when the laws of nature are weakened by the chaotic influence of an Umbral calamity.",
    brand: "Final Fantasy I",
    category: "Clay",
    price: 5.99,
    countInStock: 7,
    rating: 4.0,
    numReviews: 8,
  },
  {
    _id: "3",
    name: "BASILISK",
    image: "frontend/public/images/Basilisk-28-XV.png",
    description:
      "The Green Slime, also known as the SCUM in the NES version, is an enemy in the original Final Fantasy. Since the Green Slime has an exceedingly high Defense stat, physical attacks will be useless, but a Black Mage's Blizzara or Fira can defeat a group of them with a single cast. Their attack may cause Poison, so the party should carry some Antidotes when traveling through the Marsh Cave. As with most of the Slime family of enemies, the greatest difficulty presented is conserving the player's valuable MP.",
    brand: "Final Fantasy XV",
    category: "Lightning",
    price: 8.99,
    countInStock: 5,
    rating: 3,
    numReviews: 12,
  },
  {
    _id: "4",
    name: "NAGARANI",
    image: "frontend/public/images/Nagarani-29-XV.png",
    description:
      "Anguiform of daemon that slithers in the Crestholm Channels. She appears much like the naga, though a bed of snakes lies atop her head where her hair should be. The self-anointed queen of Crestholm has the power to turn her adversaries into stone, frogs, and worse. She’s also capable of self-destruction.",
    brand: "Final Fantasy I",
    category: "Fire",
    price: 7.99,
    countInStock: 11,
    rating: 5,
    numReviews: 12,
  },
  {
    _id: "5",
    name: "HARPEIA",
    image: "frontend/public/images/Harpeia-04-XI.png",
    description:
      "Even the normal attacks of these monsters count as special attacks, striking multiple players within range. Furthermore, they are potent spellcasters, capable of casting enfeebling and elemental magics to hinder and harm their foes, and may even have special job abilities as well.",
    brand: "Final Fantasy XI",
    category: "Air",
    price: 12.99,
    countInStock: 7,
    rating: 5,
    numReviews: 10,
  },
  {
    _id: "6",
    name: "NAGARANI",
    image: "frontend/public/images/Nagarani-29-XV.png",
    description:
      "Anguiform of daemon that slithers in the Crestholm Channels. She appears much like the naga, though a bed of snakes lies atop her head where her hair should be. The self-anointed queen of Crestholm has the power to turn her adversaries into stone, frogs, and worse. She’s also capable of self-destruction.",
    brand: "Final Fantasy I",
    category: "Fire",
    price: 7.99,
    countInStock: 11,
    rating: 5,
    numReviews: 12,
  },
];

export default products;
